intro: Hutchinsia font-queri, commonly known as the Font-Queri's hutchinsia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and unique leaf morphology. The plant is adapted to the arid and rocky environments of its native habitat. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
